channel.title: Home on Peter Mosses
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Peter Mosses

item.title: Hyperlinked Twins
item.description: Hyperlinked twins of code repositories (developed since 2023) are websites that support precise name-based code navigation using ordinary web browsers.

item.title: CBS IDE
item.description: The CBS IDE (developed in 2017) is an integrated development environment for component-based semantics.

item.title: Just the Docs
item.description: Just the Docs (contributor since 2016, maintainer since 2020) is a theme for generating static websites with Jekyll.

item.title: PLanCompS
item.description: PLanCompS (Programming Language Components and Specifications, since 2011) is an open international collaboration, continuing from an EPSRC-funded research project (2011-16).

item.title: CBS
item.description: CBS (Component-Based Semantics, since 2004) is a framework and meta-language for component-based specification of programming languages.

item.title: MSOS in Prolog
item.description: The MSOS in Prolog project (2002–2004) illustrates how MSOS rules for the dynamic semantics of a simple imperative programming language can be written as Prolog clauses.

item.title: Action Environment
item.description: The Action Environment (2001-2005) was a prototype tool that supported use of so-called constructive action semantics (a hybrid of action semantics and component-based semantics).

item.title: Prolog MSOS Tool
item.description: The Prolog MSOS Tool (2001–2004) was used to support undergraduate lectures on Fundamental Concepts and Formal Semantics of Programming Languages.

item.title: Maude Action Tool
item.description: MAT (1998–2001) was a prototype tool for action semantics and MSOS, based on Maude.

item.title: MSOS
item.description: MSOS (Modular SOS, 1999–2016) is modular variant of SOS (structural operational semantics).

item.title: ASD Tools
item.description: The ASD Tools (1992–1996) supported the original version of action semantics.

item.title: CoFI
item.description: CoFI (Common Framework Initiative, 1995–2005) was a collaborative project to develop a common framework for algebraic specification and development of software.

item.title: Unified Algebras
item.description: The Unified Algebras framework (1988–1992) allows algebraic speciﬁcation of sorts as values.

item.title: Action Semantics
item.description: Action Semantics (1985–2005) is a hybrid of denotational and operational semantics, developed in collaboration with David Watt (Glasgow).

item.title: SIS
item.description: SIS (semantics implementation system, 1972–1979) used partial evaluation to run programs according to their denotational semantics.
Executable component-based semantics #L.
Modular structural operational semantics #Peter D.

item.title: Affiliations
item.description: Affilations with academic organisations (in reverse order of starting date).

item.title: Meetings
item.description: This section lists my involvement in scientific meetings since 2005.

item.title: Research Publications
item.description: Lists of previous publications Google Scholar • DBLP • ORCID • Researchr • ResearchGate • AMiner • Scopus Latest publications # Towards Verification of a Denotational Semantics of Inheritance in JENSFEST 2024: Proceedings of the Workshop Dedicated to Jens Palsberg on the Occasion of His 60th Birthday
